pageContext.claim: “I think we're going to make a deal because they [China] don't want to lose their chains. They have supply chains that are unbelievably intricate, and people are all leaving and they're going to other countries, including the United States, by the way. We're going to get a lot of them too, a percentage. Meaning, we'll get -- I think we're going to get a higher percentage than a lot of people would think.”
pageContext.analysis: Foreign direct investment in China has continued to grow amid Trump's trade war, and experts say a few scattered cases of companies leaving do not confirm a broad trend.
